page.title: 02RIVERS TAVY AND TAMAR
page.content: The Bere Peninsula is a piece of land with rivers on three sides.On the westward side next to Cornwall is the River Tamar and on the eastward side next to Devon is a river called the River Tavy. The River Tavy starts in high Dartmoor and gradually gets bigger until it reaches the River Tamar. The Vikings used the River Tavy to reach Tavistock where they sacked the Abbey. The first bridge crossing the river from the peninsula upwards is the Tavy Bridge.The Gunnislake railway uses this bridge.The next bridge is called Denham Bridge and cars can cross this bridge. The River Tamar starts near Bude in north Cornwall.From Cornwall you can cross into the Peninsula at Calstock and again at Gunnislake.
